comment: Literally such an easy class. Make sure to take him online, and you will get a guaranteed A as long as you just submit your assignments on time. Tests are lowkey open-note since there is no lockdown browser or webcam. 5 discussion posts. Lastly, 3 different concert proofs (one of them having a required small one-page review). No textbook required.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Marsh is a very good communicator. You will have 3 KSU concerts you must attend and write a short paper on 1 of the 3. Along with 5 easy discussions and 3 60 question tests. ChatGPT is allowed in the class. He will give you many reminders throughout the semester letting you know when the concerts are and when assignments are due. Take him!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Rude and unprofessional. I politely reached out to express concerns I had about concert attendance and he replied with a snarky comment like I did something wrong by asking for clarity. The class is easy, but be prepared to figure it out on your own bc he has no involvement in the course.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: Extremely rude. For a concert review, I was confused, so I sent the ticket stub and pictures from attending the concert separately. I also asked a few questions in the first email. He did not view the first email and just replied super rudely and said I got a 0 since there was no ticket, but then later changed it to 100%. No follow-up NO sorry

There's nothing much to say about him. He's an easy A in my opinion submit your the discussion post, tests, and concerts on time. There is no reason you shouldn't have an A in the class unless your not putting in effort. So trust me when I say this TAKE HIS CLASS ONLINE!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Such an easy class, don't let these reviews fool you. I never did the reading and yet received 94+ on every single assignment. If you need to take a class of this sort then forsure do this class. Class was 5 DB's- very easy(lowest grade was a 94 probably), 3 tests(received a 97 on all of them), and you must attend 3 concerts- 2 of them being at KSU
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: We had 5 discussions (graded strictly), 3 easy tests (not lockdown), & attendance at 3 concerts, including 1 professional concert w/ a 1-page review. The class is easy but unorganized, w/ some weeks having no work. Late submissions for discussions are accepted for partial credit at the end of the semester. Stay on top of concerts and discussions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: His reviews are bad but I had no real issues. The only thing is he does grade the discussion posts harshly. But I just attended the concerts, did the tests (no lockdown, so easy), and have a good grade! He is a little snappy on emails, which is eh because his class isn't super clearly organized at times, but overall such an easy class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor is pretty straightforward. There aren't too many assignments (a lot of weeks you can get away with doing nothing)- 5 discussions, 3 tests, 3 concerts to attend, and a lot of reading and listening from the textbook. The class isn't very organized, but I don't think that will affect you too much. Plan ahead for concert attendances!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The assignments are easy; there's 3 tests, 5 discussions, and 2 concerts you need to go to. 0 teacher interactions except when grading your discussions. The discussions aren't hard, but he grades them pretty rough like he's looking for specific answers each time. Course isn't bad as long as you don't procrastinate.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Definitely take this class online. There are 5 discussion posts that aren't too hard but he grades them hard. There are 3 tests which are pretty easy and 3 concert proofs (don't wait to do them cause there are less towards the end of the semester) Its an easy class if you don't procrastinate.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Easy class, but you will 100% be learning on your own, just reading a book for the entire semester, 2 concerts, and 3 exams. Zero teacher interaction, or online videos. Which is not bad, but a shame for the amount of money you spend for tuition. Didn't retain much from this class. So if you truly want to learn music, find an in person class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: 3 tests, 3 concerts, 5 discussions, no final. He didn't teach the class since it was fully online, and you can get by without putting in a lot of effort. The concerts were cool to go to. Overall, it was a decently easy class. Definitely take it if you need a passing grade.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took the class online and I'm glad I took it over the other options. Prepare to go to concerts because they are for a grade. The professor was very easy to access through outlook whenever you had questions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Online student, this class had a good amount of reading, 3 concert viewings (u can do an online version w harder proof), 5 discussions, and 3 tests. the concerts were fun to go to, but the material was a little hard to grasp sometimes, and he was a bit iffy with communication sometimes. Not sure what its like in person but it may be a better choice
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I took music 1107 online and the your entire grade was based off 3 tests, 5 discussions and your ability to show up to 3 concerts. This class is actual BS. I got a decent grade because I could read a book and answer questions. The discussions are busy work. If you take it online like I did, there are Youtube vids u can watch to make up for concerts
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Professor Marsh back in spring 2021 for class piano and I only enjoyed piano because of him. This was the one class I actually enjoyed going to. He is always willing to help, and he genuinely wants you to succeed. If I were to stay in music, I would take him again. All you have to do is show up consistently and practice your music often.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: I took him during my freshman year (in a pandemic) & HE IS THE BEST. 3 major things: discussion, test, & concert proofs. If you take the same professor I took this semester just keep up with your discussions questions (make sure its full of content & youll get a good grade). He does offer 3 chances for extra credit for the concert proofs.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Respected--Tough grader

comment: Had him for class piano. Very inconsistent grader, and comes up with very vague reasons why.  Also misread the syllabus and had us do things far beyond what we were supposed to for a first year class. Would not recommend
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Attend the performance, read, read, read. A lot of material but the test are easy if you listen to the pieces provided.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: So Rude.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Gives no Direction and you will feel like you are lost all the time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Professor Marsh was a good teacher. The tests are very easy but the only problem is the listening at the end. He will post 30+ songs for you to listen to before each test and then expect you to figure out which one it is on the test. Discussion posts are easy and you are required to attend 3 music events.
rating_tags: Respected--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easiest class i've ever taken, the tests aren't lockdown and the discussions are fairly easy.
I finished with a 89.75 and he did not round it to an A. Then when I asked hi about it he did not respond to my email. Would not take his class.

Took the online course and passed with flying colors. He responds quickly to any emails, although sometimes a bit vaguely. Sometimes it was a bit hard to know exactly what to expect on the tests, and some of the questions would trip you up because of it. Otherwise, just read the book, do the discussions, and you should be golden.

His lectures are a little boring but I mainly worked on the study guides during them. The study guides are extremely helpful and as long as you do those you will get As on every test. Has sign in sheet every class but only chooses 2 at random to determine attendance grade at semester's end. I recommend taking this course for an easy A.

This class was frustrating.  I would play a piece perfectly and get an 84 and have no idea why.  And when I would ask him about it he couldn't tell me what I did wrong so I had no way to know what to improve for the next test.  Overall a very frustrating semester.
I didn't look both ways before crossing the street on the way to his class because I would have rather gotten hit by a car than go to this class
This class is incredibly boring. Don't wait to do your arts attendance! Read the book, listen to the listening playlists and you'll be fine.

Lectures along with the book, so follow along and highlight as you go. Listen to the playlists for the tests. Study what you've highlighted in the book. You'll have in-class assignments that come from the book, but the answers are in the back. Do your arts attendances EARLY! Very easy class, but super boring.

He is very monotone and places no effort into student interest or involvement. He will stand in front of the class and lecture at a barely audible level the entire time. I  added him onto rate my professor simply because of how awful of an experience I had with his class. He is unorganized and I would not recommend him at all.
